question_text: Which two statements about eSATA are true? (Select two)
answer_options: It supports the same transfer rates as internal SATA revisions
It uses a DB15-style connector for backward compatibility
It provides power to external drives over the same cable
It supports up to 2-meter cable length for external connections
It is electrically incompatible with SATA revision 3.0
correct_answer: It supports the same transfer rates as internal SATA revisions
It supports up to 2-meter cable length for external connections
explanation: eSATA matches SATA speed specs but has physical differences in shielding and durability. It does not carry power like USB or Thunderbolt.
